content.name: Kevin Yeh
content.title: Front End / Full Stack Developer
content.info: Hello! I am a Front End / Full Stack Developer with a background in Graphic Design. Able to grasp new skills quickly and efficiently. Even more so, passionate about learning the process. Having the patience and interests in puzzles, developing applications can be tackled on with the same mindset.
Full stack course that was an extension of UC Berkeley. Presented with certificate for completion at the end of course.
content.title: UC Berkeley Bootcamp

content.info: Took Adobe Dreamweaver classes and self taught. Graduated with bachelors in Graphic Design and received Cum Laude honors.
content.title: Notre Dame de Namur University

content.info: I did not like high school.
content.title: San Mateo High School

content.info: Single-handedly led the front end team for <bold>2.5 years</bold> after 1 year starting as a web developer, applying best practices like BEM, SCSS, and SEO.
Architected new structures that allowed for quick and complex feature/product launches resulting in <bold>3-4 per month</bold>.
Developed <bold>new</bold> school, React style, web pages and animations while using <bold>old</bold> school technologies, including ES5 and jQuery.
With over <bold>1 million</bold> products, NodeJs scripts were created to edit hundreds of thousands of products at a time while utilizing Shopify's API.
Integrating with services such as <bold>Google Optimize</bold> and <bold>Google Analytics</bold>, where key data was gathered help decide on specific needs.
Within one weekend, created a custom parallax scroll page template making it easy to <bold>plug and play</bold> which is still used to this day.
Shop clothing, accessories, protective wear and home decor designed by independent artists and manufactured responsibly. Every purchase helps communities in need.

data.title: Summary
data.info: VIDA Health is the new and improved version of <wiki data-link='vida'>VIDA</wiki>. VIDA Health includes products post COVID-19 which which range from masks to hand sanitizers. They utilize Shopify just like it's ancestor but simpler, keeping all data needed on the platform instead of multiple databases.

data.title: Duration
data.info: July 2022 - September 2022

data.title: Stack
data.info: Languages: HTML, CSS / SCSS, JS/Typescript, GraphQL
Services: Shopify, Hydrogen, Tailwind

data.title: Responsibilities
data.info: - Develop navigation and PLP (products list page).

data.title: Responsibilities
data.info: - Refactor legacy code and recreate elements into modern versions for the new site.

data.info: Website

data.title: Summary
data.info: VIDA, when I started, was an artist based product startup that allowed artists to created unique and creative products through their <wiki data-link='vida-studio'>VIDA Studio</wiki> App. In March 2020, VIDA quickly switched to support the rise of COVID 19 and started incorporating masks into their line of products. Since then, VIDA has brought in more and diverse products to help battle the global epidemic; and thus <wiki data-link='vida-health'>VIDA Health</wiki> was born.

data.title: Duration
data.info: April 2021 - November 2021

data.title: Stack
data.info: Languages: NextJS, SCSS, JS
Services: Strapi, Google Optimize

data.title: Responsibilities
data.info: - Implemented React like dynamic web views using Shopify's ES5 stack to create modern day style pages.
- Utilized CMS services, such as Strapi, with RESTful API's to create full stack features and architected JSON's for both site users and team members.
- Created Node.js scripts to automate time-consuming tasks which allowed for faster and more reliable projects.

data.info: May 2019 - June 2022

data.title: Summary
data.info: The Graphic Jar is a graphic design freelance that a college friend, Christina Sayegh, and I started in January 2017. We specialize in designs that involve branding a business, such as logos, business cards, and websites. Christina would handle all of the illustration aspects of the freelance where I would take care of any development needed.

Technologies used for the website includes HTML, CSS / SASS, Javascript and a bit of Bootstrap. The website is mobile friendly where the use of media queries and javascript were needed to change the layout of the website and navigation bar.

Another aspect of the website includes a project builder application that I have developed using ReactJS, NodeJs, and Express; also Now for deployment (link above). This application allows users to create a simple starting point for their desired project with a bit of customization. Their project is then sent to us via email where we can start the project from there.

data.title: Summary
data.info: The Deck Challenge is a mobile application that was developed for the final project during my bootcamp. It is a workout base application using a deck of playing cards as your instructor. Shown in the demo video, the workouts that you select to incorporate in your workout is randomly assigned to either red or black cards (if 2 workouts are chosen) or each of the different suits (if 4 workouts are chosen).
Technologies used are React Native, NodeJS, and MYSQL.

AThis was my first time using React Native and I absolutely enjoyed it. There are parts where I can improve, which I plan on doing as time goes by. Also plan on deploying the app onto Apple's App Store in the near future. It is quite a simple app but there are features that can be incorporated to make it excel.
